channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cabinet and rubbish dropped, 15th February
item.description:
For over a month the cabinet and bath have been present and more and more clothes and rubbish have been dumped on this side of the bush. It’s unsightly and is encouraging lots of additional litter to be put there. As well as litter in all of the bushes which should be cleared which has been there for over 6 months

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Nuthatch Gardens, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road drain is blocked (but not surface detritus), 15th February
item.description:
The road drain at this position regularly creates a huge lake covering the pavement and half the road and instead discharging the road water northwards down the private driveway to 25B, 27 and 27A (which water flow is damaging the tarmac surface).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Road, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain / pondingv, 15th February
item.description:
What three words- ///ashes.most.exam This drain ponds when ever it rains and leads to the drain sinking. When I reported some 8+ years ago I was told there were roots in the pipes. And as such the same issue has continued. This also affect the drain on the other side of this junction. To confirm - two drains. Connecting pipe issues
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Lane, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous issue, 15th February
item.description:
Just like every other day one the neighbours leaving near our street has left a absurd amount of black bags at the end of our street. I a report everyone week, the council needs to do something about this. Can this be collected asap please. Many thanks,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Way, Peckham, Greater London

item.title: 20 x 40 x 10 cm pothole on Robsart St, near Thornton Street, 15th February
item.description:
I was cycling home from Denmark Hill to Wandsworth Town one evening in the rain, and owing to an oncoming driver's desire to centre their car over a speed bump, I cycled straight into this pothole. One of the deepest I've come across. There was an almighty bang as my front wheel hit the distant edge of the pothole. I almost came off my bike into oncoming traffic. Immediate puncture, followed by time taken to get required photos and then waiting in the rain for a £20 taxi home. Also saw cars and mopeds going into the pothole with nasty crashing sounds.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Robsart Street, Brixton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
